meta_description: The Temple Theatre is Saginaw, Michigan's most historic venue for music, comedy, film, and special events.
hours_text:
# Visitor Info

## Location

The Saginaw Art Museum is located between Old Town Saginaw and Downtown Saginaw, conveniently close to several other cultural destinations in Saginaw.  
1126 N. Michigan Ave, Saginaw, MI 48602  

## Hours

Wednesday-Saturday: 12pm-5pm

_Last entry at 4:30pm._  
_Custom museum framing not available on Saturdays._

## General Admission

Adults – $7.00  
Students (with valid ID) – $5.00  
Seniors 62+ – $5.00  
12 and under – Free  
Museum Members – Free

Active-Duty US Military – Free

_Saturdays Free!_

## _General Admission may not include entry to special exhibitions._

## Parking

The Museum offers free parking to all visitors with 100 spaces. Designated accessible parking for vehicles with the appropriate disability permit is available on the North Michigan Avenue side of the building.

## Accessibility

The Saginaw Art Museum is wheelchair accessible. A wheelchair is available free of charge, on a first-come, first-served basis, inside the main entrance.

All floors and restrooms are accessible by elevator.

## Great Lakes Bay Region

The Museum hopes to have a bright future with a shared spirit of creativity by collaborating with local organizations. This collaboration lies at the heart of success for the arts community in the region. Help support the Museum and the regional organizations and businesses.

### Things to Do

  * Andersen Enrichment Center  
[www.saginaw-mi.com](http://www.saginaw-mi.com/visit/andersenenrichmentcenter/)
  * Child...
